intro: Polybotrya appressa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant found in freshwater habitats. It is characterized by its simple, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is a member of the family Lentibulariaceae, which includes many carnivorous plants. It typically grows in shallow waters and can form dense mats on the surface. Its botanical structure is adapted for both aquatic and semi-aquatic environments, supporting its unique ecological niche.
